title: Training Program Based on Representative Learning Design (RLD) for Improving Tennis Performance

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Emphasizing skill acquisition and application under game-like conditions by combining VR simulation with actual court training

learning_goals: Learners can execute tennis strokes (forehand/backhand) with ≥80% accuracy in VR simulations replicating real-match scenarios
Learners can perform self-designed training tasks ≥3 times using RPAT assessment tools to analyze performance linkage
Learners successfully execute tactical decisions (e.g., serve positioning) applying RLD principles ≥4 times in peer practice matches
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
